So it seems that you are asking whether the ResultSet and
PreparedStatement APIs support an isClosed() message.  I don't think
they do.  So, if you want your API to support it, then add
isResultSetClosed() and isPreparedStatementClosed() to your class --
depending on your need you could just check a simple state variable that
says whether they are closed (setting that when you close them) or you
could do some magic on the instance variables that programmatically
determines whether they are closed (I think that's overkill).

Is this something you need only for the test?  If so, I don't think that
it is necessary.  Just depend on the 3rd party API and trust it until
such time that you have a valid reason not to trust it.  If/When that
comes to be, write a test case that demonstrates the problem, then
design a solution (like invalidate the PS or RS).

=jason
